txt.en:
'It was on a routine patrol at the tip of Andrast where we next encountered Yarikh and his ship again, anchored, with a launch of smaller boats along the shore. He had captured villagers in an earlier raid and we were to free the prisoners.

'The Captain devised a plan to keep our men aboard our vessel to attack the Corsair ship while we made our way to the shore to deal with the captain and crew.'

He sighs.

'If only we had known....'
You know the fate of that night and the incident that befell the captain and the mariner. Return to the mariner to hear more.

'We saved the prisoners and dispatched the enemy on the shore. But the crew Yarikh left ashore was no true fighting force. They were a decoy; a trap set by Yarikh. We had fallen into the trap and our ship, Nenglor, and all her crew was the price we paid for our hubris.'
A turn in the events of their lives, the Captain and Falnavar face long odds against Yarikh and his crew.
'We set our launches in the sea...'
There is no twist in this mission.
There is something more to the mariner's tale as his countenance falls grim.
